value.title: DAX Fridays 158: PRODUCTX - Growth rate calculations
value.excerpt: Did you made a good investment last year? Do you know how to calculate that using DAX? In this video I will show you how to calculate compound growth or investment grown using PRODUCTX.   Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center  SUBSCRIBE to learn more about Power

value.title: DAX Fridays #16: DATEADD
value.excerpt: DATEADD is a really useful function to create sets of dates backwords or forward from a point in time. It is used for Previous date calculations. In this video, I show you how it works.  Link to DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.codeplex.com/  Link to YTD video and Power BI file: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5WGOTsYngCI

value.title: DAX Fridays! #173: 8 Best practices for Time Intelligence  in Power BI
value.excerpt: Follow this rules to get your time intelligence functions working in Power BI. value.title: DAX Fridays! #182: Why your  Power BI tables sometimes filter, sometimes dont
value.excerpt: Why sometimes your tables filter each other and sometimes they dont?  As a beginner, this confused me deeply, so I hope this video will clarify this for you so you dont have to wonder anymore!  Understanding relationships: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-4ybWQSRcOY  Modeling playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLDz00l_jz6zyfWLZIu8psvTESmKuVDUoG

value.title: DAX Fridays! #183: How to deal with multiple dates in Power BI
value.excerpt: So you have order date, shipped date, required date....and only one calendar. How do you manage that in power bi and DAX?  This scenario is often called role playing dimensions and in this video I will show you two ways to solve it. :) Happy Friday!!  Links to videos mentioned: Introduction to data modeling:

value.title: DAX fridays! #19: DIVIDE
value.excerpt: Let's go through DIVIDE() function available in DAX!  The DIVIDE function performs divisions and returns alternate result or BLANK() on division by 0.It is faster than the simple division operator.  NEXT VIDEO: - PREVIOUS VIDEO: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SsZseKOgrWQ   Looking for a download file?

value.title: DAX Fridays! #23: ISFILTERED
value.excerpt: In this video we will through the ISFILTERED function in DAX.  This function is useful to detect when a column has been filtered and as shown in this video you can use it to set conditions when a column has been filtered. value.title: DAX Fridays! #26: Break RANKX ties with RAND()
value.excerpt: In this video I will show you how DAX RAND function works and also how to use it to break ties on the RANKX calculation to be able to create TOP X lists in Power BI. value.excerpt: Have you ever got this error message?: A table of multiple values was supplied where a single value was expected ? value.title: DAX Fridays! #31: Rounding Time, Prices and Numbers with DAX
value.excerpt: In today’s DAX Fridays video I will show you how to round time, prices and numbers using ROUND, ROUNDUP, ROUNDDOWN, INT, TRUNC, ODD, EVEN, MROUND, FLOOR and CEILING. value.title: DAX Fridays! #66: TREATAS
value.excerpt: In this video we will go through the DAX function TREATAS.  The TREATAS DAX function allows us to create virtual relationships within tables or pass filters to tables that are not related.  Link to function in glossary:  https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/treatas-dax   Link to SQLBI blog post: https://www.sqlbi.com/articles/propagate-filters-using-treatas-in-dax/

value.title: DAX Fridays! #91: Sum child values into the parent
value.excerpt: In today's video, I will show you how to sum child values into the parent when you are dealing with hierarchies in Power BI.  This video is based on an example shown in the previous DAX Fridays! video, so I recommend you to watch that first: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e8OWQ7Xl3m0  Happy holidays!

value.title: DAX Fridays! #95: Binning, Frequency and relative frequency | Data profiler
value.excerpt: This is the first of a series of videos about data profiling and descriptive statistics. In today's video, I will show you how to bin data,  calculate the frequency and relative frequency using DAX.  What you think about the series? let me know in the comment box.  Download file here: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/median-dax-functions
